title: Generating questions and solutions documents from the same R Markdown or Quarto document
text: Instead changing include option setup chunk YAML header can specify params parameter name choosing pass knitr::opts_chunk(include) follows. generate questions solutions output documents single Rmd file run following code R prompt.
code: --- title: "Example exercise" author: "My Name" output: html_document params:   solutions: FALSE ---  ```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(include = params$solutions) ``` <!-- ...Rest of document... --> rmarkdown::render("exercise.Rmd", params = list(solutions = FALSE)) rmarkdown::render("exercise.Rmd",   output_file = "exercise-solutions",   params = list(solutions = TRUE) )

title: Generating questions and solutions documents from the same R Markdown or Quarto document
text: Quarto documents can also use parameterisation. parameters can changed arguments command line interface input params.yml file described . example, may invoke Quarto CLI follows. follows params.yml contains line solutions: TRUE. rendering using quarto R package can change parameters follows. generate questions output document run. generate solutions output document run.
code: quarto render exercise.qmd -P solutions:TRUE quarto render exercise.qmd --execute-params params.yml quarto::quarto_render("exercise.qmd", execute_params = list(solutions = "FALSE")) quarto::quarto_render("exercise.qmd",   output_file = "exercise-solutions.html",   execute_params = list(solutions = "TRUE") )
